Reviews.Title: Super for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jan Fleming-spillane
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV for the price. Frame looks like carbon fiber picture is excellent especially with blu ray. Sound is very good as good as our Sony Wega tube tv.High quality IPS panel offers excellent viewing angles. I just wish it had more sound out options. Easy set up to our comcast Magnavox hd dvr with a $3 hdmi cable.Using blu ray from ps3. Now just need a surround sound! Oh we have a VERY small house so a 32" is a great size! Buy this you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: **Panasonic ROCKS!**
Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: This Internet Connected HDTV is Awesome!  I have purchased a few other TV's in the past few months & all of them had to be returned because of defects.  This Panasonic is PERFECT!  I could not ask for more.  I do not have a DVR, Cable, Satellite or any of that high tech technology.  I just have a plain antenna and receive local channels & it works Great.The picture is bright & colorful and the 32" size works for me as I live in a 1 br apt & use it in my living room.  It is my only household TV.  If I could have afforded a larger one I would have gotten it, but this is fine.  PLUS, I saved $152.00 by purchasing it from Amazon and received it in ONE DAY!  The sound is good also.I watch a lot of movies and stream my Netflix directly to it. Once in awhile I need to turn the sound almost all the way up, but mostly it is fine. (I do have a handicap in my hearing as I have a nerve deafness in my ears and it makes me very hard of hearing, so this may be the problem & not the TV at all.) Some day I will get a sound bar or extra attachment to enhance the sound system but in the meantime I am perfectly happy with this product and Amazon's service.I highly recommend it!  GET It - You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: LP
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture. The black levels are deep and the whites bright. It does however have a glossy screen which can cause reflections on the screen in a brightly lit room. Also while most blurays look good on this television it does have problems with very dark scenes. For example in the Harry Potter movies the screen often turns so dark that you can't see what is going on in the scene. I believe that this problem is caused by the fact that this is a LCD TV rather than poor craftsmanship on the part of Panasonic. This is a small problem as the vast majority of blurays look good even in dark scenes. Overall this is a very nice TV but, if you are looking for great shadow detail spend a few dollars more and get a plasma.

Reviews.Title: Great Panasonic quality at a nice price
Reviews.Author: raiderred
Reviews.Content: I learned about 4 years ago that Panasonic is THE television to go with nowadays.  Most all experts will tell you that the best TV's today are made by Panasonic.  I was looking for a smaller TV to go in my kitchen, and this 32" fit the bill nicely.  You don't need a 1080p TV in every room in the house, at least I don't think so.  The fact that it has the new features (direct iPod connection, access to internet apps like Pandora & Netflix) was a definite plus, too.  This is a great price for this nice 720p flat screen that has Panasonic's quality and reliability.  Package was shipped quickly and arrived in good shape.  There's no reason at all not to buy your TV's from Amazon.com, especially the smaller ones that aren't all that expensive.  I bought a ZVOX 550 speaker box system to go along with this TV and I couldn't be more pleased.  The ZVOX speaker not only adds to the sound on movies, but it sounds great when playing music from the iPod hookup the TV comes with.

Reviews.Title: Missing link to success!
Reviews.Author: alphonse marcotte
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of setup and documentation was positive. the Users manual documentation concerning operation in basic mode went well. Since I wanted to implement network connectivity, It took me a while to find out that network connection required a special LAN network adapter, only identified in fine print, and expensive!

Reviews.Title: Great TV and features at an outstanding price
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R. Brant
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV last week on Amazon for my mother, who is in assisted living.  It was very easy to set up, including the Internet connectivity.  Movies streamed from Netflix appear quickly and very clearly.  Not much had to be changed from the default color and sound settings to achieve great audio and video.  The remote is easy to use and large enough to be easily controlled with my mother's arthritic hands.  The TV doesn't have great bass, but for a flat screen TV of this size, the sound quality is better than most.I am so pleased with the quality of this set for the price that I just ordered another one for our home office.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: K. Wolfthal "Amazon Fan"
Reviews.Content: I got the Panasonic last week and it has exceeded my expectations! This is my first flatscreen set, which I bought to replace an old RCA tube set that finally went after years of good service. I did a lot of research before buying. Pluses are the iPod dock, internet access, (with optional network adapter), and that I've trusted Panasonic electronics for a long time. This set is for my bedroom, and the size is perfect. I've read reviews with complaints about the Panasonic's speakers, and they are fine. More than loud enough. Maybe in a large living room you'd need better speakers, but I don't. The picture is gorgeous with my cable provider, but I will be hooking up a digital cable box soon. Bottom line, don't hesitate to buy this flatscreen, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Decent TV, Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Trailman
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV that arrived today - a great addition to my workout room. 32" is big enough for installation in front of a threadmill or exercise bike. The user interface is fast and intuitive. I did not have to look at the manual to get everything set up.I use it with an over-the-air antenna connected to my house cable with 4 other TVs. HD channels look great. SD channels look a bit spongier than on my other (1080p) sets. The internet apps are nice. Facebook is of limited use, because it shows little content and requires too much interaction. I will mostly use Netflix, which works well enough (albeit painfully slow to navigate through the Viera network).I also purchased this mount, which is more than capable of handling this light-weight TV:VideoSecu Articulating Arm TV Wall Mount for Mid Size VESA 200 100 LED LCD TV and Monitor Flat Panel Screen, Full Motion Mount Bracket with Free 6" Level and 7ft HDMI Cable A35This signal booster does a great job of pushing the antenna signal through my home to 5 TVs:4 PORT CABLE TV / HDTV / DIGITAL AMPLIFIER INTERNET MODEM SIGNAL BOOSTER INTERNET AMPTake a look at the picture that I posted for this item.

Reviews.Title: Awesome bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: BRANDON EASTRIDGE "conservative sometimes rep...
Reviews.Content: This television works perfectly in my bedroom. Having read the other reviews, I had some reservations about buying this unit. Everything has worked exactly as Panasonic has promised. The picture is great, speakers are fine (hooked up to a DVD home theater system anyway) and the Internet Apps were easy to setup. I have been buying Panasonic Tv's since '94 and have yet to be disappointed. For the price this Tv can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, especially at wide angles.
Reviews.Author: Happy Reader
Reviews.Content: This unit has as good a picture as there currently is for a small room.  The sound quality is surprisingly adequate.  Installation was quick and simple.

Reviews.Title: Never buy used electronics from Amazon Warehouse Deals!
Reviews.Author: AllanNKnox "AllanNKnox"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV used from Amazon Warehouse Deals (a subsidiary of Amazon and fulfilled by Amazon). They claimed that it was in Good Shape except for some surface marring on the cabinet. THIS WAS A LIE. The screen has a serious flaw that greatly inhibits viewing. Amazon Customer Service made a generous offer to resolve the problem, but in the end Refused to Honor their own offer.And, when I tried to complain about the resolution to an email address Amazon gave me, I got back a message that read "The recipient's mailbox is full and can't accept messages now."I am an Amazon Prime member and have been a Very Good customer of Amazon for years. This experience makes me think that Amazon has suddenly started cutting too many corners and has sacrificed customer service in the process.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our bedroom because I wanted to be able to watch Netflix in bed!  This TV is perfect for that.  It is only a 720, and I can notice the difference from our bigger 1080 in the living room.  So as long as you know what you're buying, then don't expect something better.  This TV does exactly what it says it will.  And I am thrilled with it.  The price was right and it is so much better than the 19inch old TV we had prior.  I love being able to start a Netflix TV in the family room on our Wii, and then finishing it in our bedroom.  Also, I can access all the Amazon instant movies and TV shows so that is great.  The Facebook App isn't all that great.  Haven't used it much.  Being able to connect your iPhone or iPod is also a great feature.  And so easy to figure out.  Just know that you have to have the cable to get internet or the wireless adapter which are both sold separately.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good TV
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty good. I have a regular sized room and the audio is pretty good. I was a little hesitant because of bad comments about the audio but Im satisfied with it. Picture quality is really good, no motion blur and colors seem as they should. Im streaming Netflix via ethernet cable. The way I have it set up is I have an Apple extreme router in my living room and an Apple express in my bedroom to extend the network. I have the TV connected to the Apple express via ethernet and it streams without hiccup. Overall pretty nice tv. Buy it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV, happy to get it from Amazon.
Reviews.Author: Mirandacake
Reviews.Content: I have this TV in a secondary room where I ride a stationary bike.  Ye old tube TV was starting to have terrible picture, so this is it's replacement.  Stand was easy to assemble-straightforward directions.  Sound is good, picture is excellent-even at the diagonal that I am viewing it from.  Happy that it has internet connectivity, however I am not going to buy a $60+ adapter.  If you think a generic wifi adapter will work, think again (mine didn't).  Keeping the box for 30 days just in case anything goes wrong.  I chose this TV over several others and was happy I did.  I will probably run a cat5e cable to it eventually so I can use Netflix on it.  The ipod/iphone dock lets you control the music with the television remote.  You can charge your device while using the TV for other stuff as well (like playing Oblivion, which looks amazing).

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Alan Shearer
Reviews.Content: We got this for our bedrom to replace an old CRT with an original xbox running xbmc.  We primarily only view Netflix and Hulu (through PlayOn).  Netflix and the TV itself have been great.The only downside is the DLNA client.  It has a really annoying feature that cant be turned off of starting the selected video as a preview, but not cancelling the stream even when you select another video in a list (not even pressing play).  This causes issues with the streaming quality.  Also pausing DLNA videos sometimes takes you back to the beginning when you press play again which is annoying.Besides that the TV itself and the built-in Netflix and ability to play media off of USB have been great.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, nice HD
Reviews.Author: Shelly R. "Gurrrlz can purrr"
Reviews.Content: This was my first HD TV, I am replacing my 27" crt. I can say I am very happy with the picture, as the ips screen allows off-center seating, and the color is fabulous. The sound takes some "dialing in" to get it right, but it is adiquate. If you want better, go 5.1 surround. I have not hooked it to my computer or the net yet, so I will reserve judgement on those issues. As a TV, hooked to a BD player, this is excellent, I could not have asked for better. This HD TV is a great deal. * Now that I have had a chance to live with this tv. The instructions for the sound are inadequate, and now that I have worked with it, I think the sound is suprisingly quite good in fact. The picture quality is excellent. This tv is turning out to be a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: nice picture, TERRIBLE sound
Reviews.Author: D. Olson
Reviews.Content: i have owned this TV for 2 years to be used mostly as a computer monitor..  it was the best decision i have ever made in regards to a quality inexpensive monitor.. that being said the audio levels are ridiculously inconsistent. in my situation this issue is not too much of a hinderance since i mostly run the audio through my surround sound system and don't need a strong audio signal from the tv's internal speakers.. but if you plan on using only the internal speakers expect to turn the volume WAY up for varying situations like watching a dvd, streaming from a computer, or watching cable television...  all in all i do very much appreciate the contrast ration and overall picture quality from even non-HD video... side-note: if you are a non-HD user, use component cables... analog will look much worse on this tv than an old tube style tv

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Gary L
Reviews.Content: This has been a great tv.  Set-up was very easy. Picture quality is very good and so its the audio.  Connected to the internet with no problem to watch Amazon Prime videos.

Reviews.Title: Best In Class
Reviews.Author: M. M. Chow "mighty18"
Reviews.Content: Clearly the best in the 32 inch 'LCD' class with internet connection for under $400.  Panasonic being consistently among the top brands in Consumer Reports 'reliability' ratings made this an easy choice.  729p is enough for a 32 inch set and the picture quality is fantastic.  Despite some reviews of 'weak' audio I find it exceptional as a TV this size is intended for small rooms.  I may not use the iPod adapter often but it is an added bonus to have.PROs: Wide viewing angle; iPod(Phone) adapter; Facebook (I may never find myself Facebooking on a TV but it is available).CONs: YouTube app not among the internet apps as with my Viera plasma TV.  (Will gladly trade Facebook for YouTube)

Reviews.Title: Great pictures with all the extras. TV, Blu-Ray look great.
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: I needed a new TV for my bedroom. After doing weeks worth of research and price watching I finally decided on the Panasonic L32X30. I had never purchased a Panasonic TV before or been to a home that had one so I was a little nervous about how the picture quality would turn out. I have had the TV for two days and to my delight the picture quality is fantastic. It did take me a little bit to get the color and brightness settings where I wanted them. The "Standard" setting was a little bit dark. One of the best parts of this TV are the extra features which I couldn't find anywhere else for the price. The internet features are great (especially if you have Amazon Prime). Luckily my TV is close to my router so I didn't have to buy the wireless adapter.  My wife loves that she can plug in her iphone or ipod as well! I am usually loyal to Samsung or Sony but I will have to add Panasonic to my list. The 720p and 1080i both look great. For this size not having 1080p doesn't seem to make a difference. I highly reccomend this TV to anyone looking for a mid to high end 32" for bedroom, office, etc.

Reviews.Title: good TV, but misleading
Reviews.Author: Aron
Reviews.Content: Everything looks good so far, but it says Wi-Fi ready, which actually means Wi-Fi ready if you buy an adapter... which is another $60...

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L32X30 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Byron L. Lagoy "B. LaGoy"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Panasonic flat screen we've purchased from Amazon in the last few years.  The first was a 42" plasma for the front room, then a 26" lcd for the bedroom, and now this 32" for our daughter on the other side of the country in NYC.  Not much to say.  She and her boyfriend are as pleased with their Panasonic as we are with ours.  We have not (so far) had any problems, either with Amazon's delivery or Panasonic's performance.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV.
Reviews.Author: Ana Pendragon
Reviews.Content: It's not plasma quality - but I don't think they make plasmas this small.It's working great in my tiny home office space.The main feature I had to have was the "smart" ethernet connection for Amazon prime videos.

Reviews.Title: good tv, great price
Reviews.Author: liseV
Reviews.Content: upgraded from my huge console and really like all the features and iphone connectivitythe only negative is the sound quality.  Not great and when watching movies some scenes are very loud while the dialogue can be hard to hear. Might upgrade with some external speakers

Reviews.Title: Pana-Vision
Reviews.Author: DKCafe "DKC"
Reviews.Content: This TV was all show and tell right out of the box. Without a HD converter, you couldn't tell the difference.So, I can delay the purchase of a Blu-Ray player. Yes, the TV shows very well, it's that good! Buy one or two.

Reviews.Title: A winner!
Reviews.Author: Texan
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the TV, it's all we had hoped for and more. Having the IPOD dock is a plus for my husband!!!Thanks you for the good fast delivery and good service.

Reviews.Title: TV is GREAT, internet is restricted to factory set aps.  Cumbersome remote!
Reviews.Author: Lynn K
Reviews.Content: As a TV, it works very well.  The picture, sound and motion are all well done.  The I-phone dock works well and is a nice addition!  There are a lot of adjustments to personalize the picture for movies, sports, etc. There are also adjustments for the sound - base and treble and other adjustments.  And a way to set several groupings of "channel selections" for either cable or antenna, or other sets of channels.  All of these are great, I use them, and they are appreciated.  I am very disappointed in the remote - caveman design, or lack of design.  They really did not care about the remote.  Internet TV - Yes, I can easily get Netflicks, Amazon Prime, Pandora, Youtube, Facebook and more factory set internet sites, BUT it is limited to the factory set aps.  I can not add other aps or internet capability.  Also the wireless internet adapter is separate, over priced, & SPECIFIC ONLY TO PANASONIC.  Generic ones will not work!  Also the Digital Audio In is also Panasonic Only!

Reviews.Title: Will never buy Panasonic again!
Reviews.Author: TropicalFish
Reviews.Content: This set cost me just under $400. Literally one day before the one year warranty expired, the TV suddenly went black and wouldn't turn on. Turned out to have the "flash of death," meaning the most expensive repair it can need. I called the company, but could not get through, was on hold for an hour total and disconnected TWICE! That was a Friday. I called on Monday, but they said because it was now a few DAYS after warranty, even though the breakage happened before it expired, they would not honor the warranty. The call center is the most unhelpful, impossible to reach, circular mess I have ever encountered. They told me to go get it repaired, and said AFTER I paid for it they MIGHT cover part of the cost. They gave me an address nowhere near where I lived to do it, despite repeatedly telling them it was not near me. The rep told me he did not know how to get something for my city - really? I was in NYC at the time! They wanted me to go 40 miles away with no car, for a TV they may or may not partially cover! They were rude about it on top of it.I was told I would get calls back over and over, and this dragged on for a month but no one ever called back. Finally I sent a ton of emails and managed to get the problem escalated. I was told I had only 2 days to get the diagnosis, because after that the "partial warranty coverage date" would pass - despite the fact that all the time had passed because of their fault! I actually did drag myself all the way out there in a friend's car to get the estimate, and was told I would have to drag the TV back home and come back again, Panasonic did not compensate them to keep the sets prior to work done. The estimate was $412!! More than the entire set cost in the first place just a year ago. I had to lose my mind with the Panasonic manager (who barely spoke English) to get it covered. They did, but they refused to cover the "diagnostic fee" - which was a whopping additional $80 that I had already paid, because a previous rep told me it would be reimbursed. No one was held accountable, and at that point I just wanted to be done with this and make Panasonic pay as much as possible - if I didn't fix the TV, I would be out $80 with a broken TV.I used to think Panasonic was a respectable company. I will never ever buy a major electronic appliance from them, and I plan to spread the word as much as possible, their TVs are junk, and they do not stand by their products or their customers. Before I upgraded to this TV to get Netflix on it, I was using my old Phillips Magnavox TV I bought in 1999 for $100. That TV STILL WORKS, I have never had a single problem with it, despite it now being 14 years old! Panasonic couldn't even make a TV that lasted a year, and sure enough many reviews online prove I am far from the only one who has this problem with their products or their customer service.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Satisfied with this Purchase
Reviews.Author: Sharon D. Jones
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my son's room.  He's had it for a year now and we have no complaints.  Great picture quality, connects with all his gaming, video and electronic devices and the "foot" stand that it comes with was easy to install after we decided against defacing the wall in his room by attaching it above the dresser.

Reviews.Title: 32 in panasonic lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Jaynes "kim"
Reviews.Content: shipped very quickly. Tv has great quality picture and sound. Like all the extra features. Spent extra money on quality name so hoping it will last for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Major Wow Factor
Reviews.Author: DarWhisp
Reviews.Content: Got this for our bedroom for Xmas as our first HDTV.Cable box died, so just bringing cable into the TV cable port.Finding Nemo was on ABC Family channel...blew me away.Seems to be best WiFi ready HDTV for under $400.Supply seemed tight (Amazon out of) so we jumped on B&H; offer.Have not tried WiFi yet but saw the adapter on Amazon ~$25+ship.Considered SONY and Visio options but the Amazon reviews helped decide.UPDATE-  Still enjoying this TV.For WiFi adapter picked up refurb NETGEAR WNDA3100v2 from EBay low cost.Also picked up a refurb NETGEAR 3700v2 wireless router with dual band freq.Seems to work well we get NETFLIX and AMAZON instant movies nicely.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-L32X30
Reviews.Author: P. Degen
Reviews.Content: No compolaints so far but it's a Christmas gift and won't be opened until Dec. 25.  The box arrived with minor damage. TV works fine and has no damage.

Reviews.Title: WiFi Ready = requires a wireless adapter
Reviews.Author: Anthony Woltermann
Reviews.Content: Television is fine overall.  I prefer the picture quality of the Samsung LCDs, but the price was right.  I could find no reference to the need for a wireless LAN adapter on the Amazon description page and the Panasonic page didn't even recognize the model number.Frustrating that I now have to track down and buy the wireless adapter.  Even more frustrating that I had to sit on hold with Panasonic support for 20 minutes to verify my suspicions.  The only reference to the adapter in the manual is a somewhat vague mention on page 16.

Reviews.Title: dlna is not very good. picture quality is ok. 32" smart tv.
Reviews.Author: Peter Ian Staker
Reviews.Content: an important problem with this tv for anyone who is a heavy dlna user, is this tv cannot handle as many file types as samsung dlna (does handle mkv, however), and it does not playback 1080p very well using dlna. also, it does not decode 5.1, although it MIGHT pass through via optical out if you hook it up to a receiver (which is unlikely on a set this small). that was my main gripe. another annoying thing is it has permanent overscan that you cannot disable. other than that, picture quality is nothing fancy; its tolerable. its only redeeming quality is it being a smart tv with netflix + amazon vod--rare for this size+price; netflix is not searchable, btw. havent tried games on it, so cant comment on input lag, but ive heard good things about other panasonic tvs with ips alpha panels. despite the huge dlna flaws, a pretty good buy considering the other features.update 1/19/2012: finally played some games on this (in game mode), and the input lag is low. not quite as good as an asus "evo" monitor, but close. definitely less lag than the vast majority of 32" displays. im leaving the star rating at 3 because of the crap dlna, however--its basically useless in my opinion; just an excuse to have it listed in the specs. also, another annoyance, the only audio out the tv has is optical/toslink.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: Walter L. Martinez
Reviews.Content: I am in the process of replacing all my SD CRT TVs.  This is my first HD TV, so I decided to replace one of the smaller units first to get a feel of what is out there before replacing the largest of my arsenal, the living room TV.  I went with the Panasonic VIERA TC-L32X30 after looking at Sony, Samsung, and Phillips 32" LCD models for the bedroom primarily because this was the only quality brand that had Internet capability at a low price.  In a nutshell, this TV has exceeded my expectations in most areas although the Audio could be better, but that could be solved by an external speaker.  I use only antenna as the source, but where I live the Radio and TV transmitters are sitting on top of a 10K+ peak, so the signal comes in crystal clear with coax cable.  The amazing picture is motivating me to replace the other units soon than planned and with the exceptional service that Amazon provides; I will certainly be acquiring the other TVs here.  The free shipping is also a plus.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TV
Reviews.Author: MikesGoneFishing
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. I love the easy setup for Netflix. Great color, descent sound quality. Only flaw is there is no external sound jack for headphones.

Reviews.Title: TV Gets a 5 Star Rating and Amazon gets a 1 Star Rating
Reviews.Author: jaldeborgh "jaldeborgh"
Reviews.Content: This Review is mostly about Amazon but first the TV.  I bought this for my daughters birthday - she is away at college and is thrilled with the TV and its features.  Everything works and the feature set is great for a college age kid - the IPTV (Netflix) and ability to connect to her iPhone as well as the ability to look at pictures directly from an SD card are the big ones.  She had been using a 4 year old 24" Westinghouse that was both a very marginal and small TV so this was a great upgrade.Now for Amazon - I bought this TV from the Amazon Warehouse and it was labeled as "Like New" this was okay as it saved me about $50.  Within 2 days of the ordering the TV the price dropped about $40 for the exact same TV - this always makes me crazy.  At this point the TV had been shipped but had not been delivered. I emailed Amazon (twice) and was told to go pound sand (twice).  I carefully explained that I could easily refuse the shipment and simply reorder the TV but that I wanted to save Amazon the cost of the return shipping plus the administrative cost of reordering the TV and the cost of reshipping a 2nd TV.  But in spite of this reasonable and logical request I was again told to go pound sand. All I wanted (requested) was a refund of the price difference - a reasonable request - I think.Over the past 10+ years I have been a good and loyal customer of Amazon.com but I have now lost a good deal of regard for this company.  I feel that their response was poor and does not reflect a good customer attitude.In the end I did not want to make my daughter a victim of Amazon.com's stupidity so I bit my lip and allowed the TV to be delivered - and I will pay the higher price.  I will not however forget and Amazon.com will be the ultimate looser as I plan to share this story as often as I can with anyone who might care to listen.  It's not the money it's the poor customer attitude.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic brand a waste of money
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON A PANASONIC PRODUCT! I purchased a flat screen for a friend and it lasted less than 2.5 years. If there is a problem with your TV Panasonic does not want to hear from you if you need repairs but will gladly offer to sell you another piece of junk TV. Without looking at it Panasonic knew that the "motherboard had been fried." Perhaps they've encountered this problem thousands of times before. If you look at your flat screen as a disposable product, the picture is great. If you'd like your investment to last a while run from the PANASONIC brand. You have been warned.

ProductInfo.Features:
IPS Alpha Panel
iPod/iPhone Entertainment Kit
VIERA Image Viewer (Video and Photo)
DLNA (Wi-Fi ready)
Easy IPTV
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic VIERA TC-L32X30 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
